results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 5. Season 2. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Julie McSwiney, Ray Boseley, David Swann, Bernadette O'Mahony, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: Marcello alienates himself from the team when he uses a ‘cheat’ website to help him beat Bec in the school essay contest. Episode 7: After Bec returns from a trip to Silicon Valley in the USA, her cocky too-cool-for-school attitude threatens the effectiveness of the team. Episode 8: Marcello’s latest scheme, a “virtual band”, takes off and he becomes, on paper at least, a millionaire. But has he really hit the big time? Episode 9: A famous hacker steals Alex’s new game. When Marcello realises the hacker is someone he knows he has to make a difficult decision. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: College Slam for Game Boy
results.creator_credit: Acclaim Entertainment Ltd and Torus Games
results.brief_description:
Part of the NBA Jam series of basketball games, College Slam allows the player to choose from 44 real college teams and take part in head-to-head games, tournaments, and season-long series in arcade-style two-on-two frenetic gameplay. Each side starts out by picking any two out of five players from a team to play with. During timeouts and half-time, the player has a choice to make substitutions. Making three baskets in a row without the other team scoring, powers the player up which makes it easier to score.

This points to the unrealistic nature of the game, where players can make full-court shots with relative ease, characters frequently jump higher than the net and may get struck by lightning during dunks. The game features customizable teams and players and fight songs from all the available teams.

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 4. Season 2. Eps 01-05
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Julie McSwiney, Ray Boseley, David Swann, Bernadette O'Mahony, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 1: The second season of the series opens with Catalyst on the brink of financial ruin. The kids find an electronic solution to the company’s woes. Episode 2. An inventor brings radical 3-D classes to Catalyst and Alex and the team must select the perfect game for showcasing them to the world. Episode 3: The lure of a program that can order all the free stuff from the Net automatically inspires Marcello’s latest brainwave. Episode 4: The kids are torn between their principles and their allegiance to Alex when they go on strike for better conditions. Episode 5: Mike becomes drawn in to a violent game on the Net after he breaks up with Pi. Things get out of hand when ‘Damon’, an evil character from the game follows Mike into the real world. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.

Episode 3: The lure of a program that can order all the free stuff from the Net automatically inspires Marcello’s latest brainwave. results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 3. Season 1. Eps 10-13
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 10: When a stranger arrives at Catalyst with a new game he claims to have invented, Alex is eager to invest in it. When Mike discovers the game is stolen he teams up with Pi to save Alex from embarrassment. Episode 11: Marcello and Mike are forced to face some home truths about people they have idolised. Episode 12: After Marcello throws Catalyst into panic when he hacks into the computer system, the rest of the kids have to decide where to place their allegiances - with Marcello or Alex. Episode 13: When Virgil is ‘captured’ by opposing games company Sunijim, Marcello attempts to redeem himself in Alex’s eyes by rescuing him. After he also runs into difficulties the friends use their computer skills to save them both and reunite the Crash Zone team. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 2. Season 1. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: When Bec begins a ‘Net romance’ the boys are sceptical. Their worst fears are realised when they discover that it is Virgil, their A.I. friend that is wooing her. Episode 7: Bec and Pi have differences of opinion when they design a game for girls about teenage romance. The resulting mess causes the team to acknowledge they still have a lot to learn about emotions and life. Episode 8: When a reporter arrives at Catalyst to do a story on the testers, they have suspicions she may be a spy. Pi, who has led the gang to believe she is a street kid, is unmasked when her mother tracks her to the company. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 1. Season 1. Eps 01-05
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 1: Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram all decipher a coded message on the net which leads them to Catalyst software where they are offered the job of their dreams - testing video games after school. Episode 2: While testing a video game the kids encounter Virgil, an artificial intelligence that lives inside the Internet, and uncover his origins. Episode 3: When Alex, the head of Catalyst, loses her necklace, the gang comes under suspicion. At the same time Marcello’s little sister is lost on the streets, giving the friends two cases to solve. Episode 4: Master inventor and the youngest of the group Ram, gets more than he bargained for when he sells one of his adventures to a strange girl. Episode 5: A computer virus invades Catalyst threatening the company’s computer systems. The team is tense after Mike fails to defend Bec when his friends make racist comments to her. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: There we are John...Derek Jarman interviewed by John Cartwright
results.creator_credit: Ken McMullen, Hannah Wiggin, Guy Landver and British Council
results.brief_description: Controversial director Derek Jarman talks one on one with John Cartwright at Dungeness about his work. Throughout the beautifully shot interview, Jarman discusses various issues including being labelled a director as opposed to a painter, film technique in the 1980s (especially working with Super 8), the incorrect assumption that his work is avant-garde, public reaction to his films “Sebastiane” (1976) and “Jubilee” (1978), “The Tempest” (1979), “Caravaggio” (1986), “The Garden” (1990), “Last of England” (1987), the film he forgot he made - “War requiem” (1989), and the film he remembers most fondly - “The Angelic conversation” (1985). Jarman also talks about converting “Edward II” (1991) to screen and his selection of images (or lack thereof) in his personal tribute to his experience of battling with AIDS; “Blue” (1993).
results.title_for_label: There we are John…Derek Jarman interviewed by John Cartwright

results.title: There is still time
results.creator_credit: Jack Zolov, Zolov Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Barbara Ward, internationally known economist and author, acts as on-camera guide in this film about Quebec, a city chosen for its intrinsic beauty and its particular stage of development. She discusses the good and bad effects of modernization on a city, and selects locations to illustrate her arguments.

results.title: The trials of life: a natural history of behaviour. - Part 1.
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, Turner Broadcasting System, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC
results.brief_description: Six half-hour episodes of David Attenborough’s series on animal behaviour, examining why creatures behave as they do and showing that their lives are a series of problems to be faced and overcome. The episodes are - 1. Arriving (on reproduction and birth) 2. Growing up (on parental protection) 3. Finding food (the interdependence of plants and animals) 4. Hunting & escaping (Attack and defence behaviour) 5. Living together (Companion species) 6. Home making (Burrows, nests etc. for safety).

results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Jones, Turner Broadcasting System, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC

results.title: Visitors in time
results.brief_description: Explores the way of life of the inhabitants of the former Portuguese island of Timor in the Malay archipelago. Shows the various ways in which these islanders earn a living, highlights the similarities between an ancient people and their present day descendants.
